eb215559f21ce08fc2c0af415cb66253 (03:49): Check-in: http://hg.mozilla.org/releases/mozilla-1.9.2/rev/18ac94cc350c - John Schoenick - bug 702466, imported patch fix_via_handler_table, r c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059, a=dveditz

050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (03:59): 8ff32489f92f33416694be8fdc2d4c22drew! and here I was just working my way up to trying to convince myself I should do a merge even though I didn't much want to :)
8ff32489f92f33416694be8fdc2d4c22 (04:21): 050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7: my goodness
8ff32489f92f33416694be8fdc2d4c22 (04:22): it took a while to mark those bugs
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (04:22): yeah, that's not the most popular part of merging
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (04:23): personally, I prefer it to having my merge program pop up with an incomprehensible muddle of js/src/
8ff32489f92f33416694be8fdc2d4c22 (04:27): i wonder how many bugs have never been marked fixed because of being missed in a list of dozens of merged changesets

eb215559f21ce08fc2c0af415cb66253 (04:30): Check-in: http://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/rev/aee879a3190a - John Schoenick - bug 702466, imported patch fix_via_handler_table, r c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059, a=dveditz
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (04:33): if you hover the bug number in your merge on tbpl, we'll fetch the summary and the status for you, so you can see if they're all RESOLVED
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (04:34): not quickly enough to be tolerable on my connection, but my memory of it is that it's not too bad on a decent connection
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (04:36): bleah, that doesn't really work, we must over-cache it, since ones that are resolved that I've already hovered show up as NEW
c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 (04:37): 56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374: are you landing on aurora and beta too?

ac495561e6015364214b354ab23f7d2d (04:37): khuey: I moved my working patch to this computer.  updated m-c..  qpush patch  got a bunch of rejects :(  refreshed..build  and got this http://pastebin.mozilla.org/1465709
050421e96671fe1a3d8cf2b5dbe99cb7 (04:37): itym dveditz
56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374 (04:38): c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059: I'm not landing these, I believe dveditz is based on his discussions with alex
56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374 (04:38): ( I don't have commit access to land on aurora/beta either )
67b8dbbd954f99b0be64bce6b421d195 (04:39): ac495561e6015364214b354ab23f7d2d: looks like IDBDatabase.h is missing an include?
67b8dbbd954f99b0be64bce6b421d195 (04:39): perhaps of nsDOMEventTargetHelper.h?
c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 (04:40): 56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374: sounds like you guys are on it either way, so i'll head out
56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374 (04:41): c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059: It's more of dveditz is on it, I'm just here to answer questions :-P
c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 (04:41): 56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374: thanks for writing up the patches!
56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374 (04:41): c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059: But yeah, it sounds like it's handled
c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 (04:41): 56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374: answering questions helps a lot

c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 (04:42): 56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374: by the way, so the reason that i feel confident about the table fix, is that we'll always call *some* handler from the table
c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 (04:43): 56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374: so if that handler is the only one that's in the table then we know it'll get called until the table is switched out
56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374 (04:43): c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059: Yeah, I agree it's probably the best way to do it, given that it's guaranteed to always be that handler table

56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374 (04:43): c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059: When I wrote the original patch I didn't fully understand the handler table selection, so I wasn't sure if we could guarantee that'd be the case
c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 (04:43): 56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374: and switching table only happens if we actually start compiling a stylesheet
c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 (04:44): 56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374: yeah, makes total sense, that stuff isn't easy until you understand all parts of it
c480405f460f7a61964569640a6cd059 (04:44): 56d2453b24865c55b5be2f927f78b374: it was a lot of fun writing, but I should have written more docs
ac495561e6015364214b354ab23f7d2d (04:46): khuey|away: I added |#include "nsDOMEventTargetHelper.h"| but that didn't work
ac495561e6015364214b354ab23f7d2d (04:46): or maybe I'm supposed to clobber first?
